info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 10 at 4:40AM MST until January 12 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 5 PM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THURSDAY TO 5 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 9 inches possible. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 55 below zero. * WHERE...Southern Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon today to 5 PM MST Thursday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late tonight through Friday afternoon. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 PM Thursday to 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult and tire chains may be required for some vehicles. Those in the backcountry should ensure they are prepared for dangerous conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
